actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on October 2, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Bice moved that the House do now adjourn.
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 335
actions-list.actionItem: 91 (Roll no. 513).
Mr. Diaz-Balart asked unanimous consent that the text of H.R. 5860 be modified by the amendment placed at the desk. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Diaz-Balart asked unanimous consent for an additional 10 minutes of debate on each side of the aisle. Agreed to without objection.
The House resumed debate on H.R. 5860.

actions-list.header: On motion to adjourn Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 0

actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Clark (MA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5860.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Ms. Granger moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5860 "Making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2024, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 30.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Tony Gonzales (TX) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Tony Gonzales (TX) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David Schweikert to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
